item.title: Leslie add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "A faithful friend is a strong defense; And he that hath found him hath found a treasure." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Amos Bronson Alcott
item.description: "Stay is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary." -- Amos Bronson Alcott

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "That is a good book it seems to me, which is opened with expectation and closed with profit." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "He was the first, the only love her life, and in a nature like hers such passions take deep root and die-hard." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "You speak an infinite deal of nothing." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lord Polonius: What do you read, my lord? Hamlet: Words, words, words. Lord Polonius: What is the matter, my lord? Hamlet: Between who? Lord Polonius: I mean, the matter that you read, my lord." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "To weep is to make less the depth of grief." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "We know what we are, but not what we may be." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "There are more things in Heaven and Earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Henry van Dyke
item.description: "Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not." -- Henry van Dyke

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Presume not that I am the thing I was." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The first thing we do, let's kill all the lawyers." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If we shadows have offended, Think but this, and all is mended, That you have but slumber'd here While these visions did appear." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Mary Baker Eddy
item.description: "To those leaning on the sustaining infinite, today is big with blessings." -- Mary Baker Eddy

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson
